Class: ProximityTracker

ai/proximity-tracker. ProximityTracker

new ProximityTracker(cellSize)

The proximity tracker tracks sprites and allows you to perform fast queries to find what sprites are closest to a given point.

The proximity tracker must be informed when a sprite moves. The easiest way to do this is via the track sprite plugin. See track for implementation details.

This constructor is curried when exposed through the engine ref, which is the prefered way to create it. This means construct it without the first parameter, e.g. new sn.ProximityTracker(myCellSize);

Parameters:
Name Type Description
cellSize Number The width of each cell in the regular grid tracking the map contents.

Methods

find(x, y, r, sort) → {Array}

Finds the sprites nearest a point. Ignores height.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
x Number The x world position of the test point
y Number The y world position of the test point
r Number The radius to search. Note that although this is in pixels, it is horizontal pixels. The search area will be an ellipse to account for the isometric projection.
sort Boolean Pass true to have the results sorted in ascending distance from the test point.
Returns:
An array of sprites that fall within the search area.
Type
Array

register(sprite)

Register a sprite with this tracker. See track for an example of how this is used with the track sprite plugin.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
sprite Object The sprite to register.

track(sprite)

Use this in conjunction with the track plugin. Add it to the list of sprite updaters on your tracked sprites, after the sprite has moved. E.g. 
updates:[{
  name: 'some-sprite-moving-plugin'
}, {
  name:'track',
  fn: myTracker.track.bind(myProximityTracker),
  register: myTracker.register.bind(myProximityTracker),
  deregister: myTracker.unregister.bind(myProximityTracker)
}]
Parameters:
Name Type Description
sprite Object The sprite to update tracking information for.

unregister(sprite)

Unregister a sprite with this tracker. See track for an example of how this is used with the track sprite plugin.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
sprite Object The sprite to unregister.
